Articles.Content:
I don\'t think this has been done yet, or if it has, at least hasn\'t been published.

I\'d like to share two designs I created tonight at 2 AM

The first I call Inverse, because I inversed all of its wings and control surfaces - even landing gear - 180 degrees.

Look at this beautiful thing:

> ![JzDs6.png](http://i.imgur.com/JzDs6.png)
> It flies!
> 
> ![9yoMah.png](http://i.imgur.com/9yoMah.png)
> 
> ... it spins!
> 
> ![dS7Ksh.png](http://i.imgur.com/dS7Ksh.png)
> 
> ... nevermind
> 
> ![hdUgjh.png](http://i.imgur.com/hdUgjh.png)

The next I call Reverse, because *everything* is backwards. It doesn\'t even face the runway. 

It flies!

> ![lyiEch.png](http://i.imgur.com/lyiEch.png)
> ...nevermind
> 
> ![ieAE3h.png](http://i.imgur.com/ieAE3h.png)

My challenge to you (this is a challenge thread too, yay) is to actually fly these planes... anywhere. And land them again. Total distance travelled must be over 2 km. 

Inverse will do that death roll if you leave SAS on while it\'s in air, but if you turn SAS off you will break your engine off lifting off the pad (turn is too sharp or something). 

Reverse... I don\'t know. Nothing I tried could get it out of its... brick fall. **NOTE**: All controls are also reversed. If you want to turn left, try to turn right. 

Minor modifications like more or less control surfaces are okay, but make sure they\'re inverse ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Otherwise use provided .crafts if you want to try this ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
You\'re insane for treating your kerbals like this and you should feel bad. Let me give it a try. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I accept this challenge! Having to land without SAS on something that wants to roll constantly and without a joystick sounds like a joy. I\'ll check back later tonight with an update. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Any success stories? Tears of frustration? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
One last bump. If nobody replies, I\'ll assume you\'re defeated by the challenge of flying these complete failures marvels of engineering.
I\'d be ashamed if I called it an SU-47 attempt. No, somepony else has already done that, and it wasn\'t my objective.
